q5.question: Why did director Reed Cowan switch his focus to Morman ideology?
q5.answer: ['to shed light on their view on marriage rights and the money behind campaigns']
q5.recall: Director Reed Cowan switched his focus to Mormon ideology because he was appalled by the involvement of the Mormon Church in the marriage debate, considering their own history of practicing alternative marriage (polygamy). He collected secret recordings, secret documents, and never before seen footage exposing Mormon efforts to deny rights to LGBT citizens worldwide.
q5.vectordb: Director Reed Cowan switched his focus to Mormon ideology because he was appalled by the involvement of the Mormon Church in the fight against LGBT rights, particularly their efforts to quash any rights for LGBT citizens. As a former Mormon missionary, Cowan was shocked that a church that practices alternative marriage (polygamy) would be so vehemently against marriage equality. He collected secret recordings, documents, and footage exposing the Mormon Church's actions and discrimination against LGBT individuals. The documentary "8: The Mormon Proposition" explores these issues and sheds light on the Mormon Church's campaigns against LGBT rights. Cowan's goal was to raise awareness and encourage action to protect human rights and prevent similar election shams in the future.
q5.hybrid: Director Reed Cowan switched his focus to Mormon ideology because he was appalled by the involvement of the Mormon Church in the marriage debate, considering their own history of practicing alternative marriage (polygamy). He collected secret recordings, secret documents, and never before seen footage exposing Mormon efforts to deny rights to LGBT citizens worldwide.
